content:
IHttpModule Interface

Definition

Provides module initialization and disposal events to the implementing class.

In this Article

public interface IHttpModule

Examples

For an example of a custom module that implements IHttpModule, see Walkthrough: Creating and Registering a Custom HTTP Module.

Methods

Dispose()

Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the module that implements IHttpModule.

public void Dispose ();

Remarks

The Dispose method performs any final cleanup work prior to removal of the module from the execution pipeline.

Init(HttpApplication)

Initializes a module and prepares it to handle requests.

public void Init (System.Web.HttpApplication context);
Parameters
context
HttpApplication

An HttpApplication that provides access to the methods, properties, and events common to all application objects within an ASP.NET application

Remarks

Use the Init method to register event handling methods with specific events.
